NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Feis Ile 2008
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This bottling was created to celebrate the 2008 Feis Ile.

NAME: Highland Park - Tampa Bay Edition Single Cask Series #699 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the very large series of single casks produced by the Orcadian distillery, Highland Park. This is the Tampa Bay edition which is a 10 year old from a refill hogshead. 
It was distilled in 2007 and bottled in 2017 from cask #699.

NAME: Glenallachie - 13 Year Old 2006 Single Cask #6601 - Spirit of Speyside 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask release was specially selected for the 2020 Spirit of Speyside festival.  Distilled on the 19th of June 2006 and has been aged 13 years in a single PX Hogshead  #6601. 
This is one of 332 bottles.

NAME: Caol Ila - 16 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A 16 year old double matured in refill then Amoroso-seasoned hogshead.  The Fèis Ìle 2020 Edition of Caol Ila has been finely rehearsed to give its own smooth virtuoso performance.  Bottled at the natural cask strength of 53.9%. This is one of 3000 bottles released.
This is bottle number 2960.

NAME: Ardbeg - Dark Cove 2016
DESCRIPTION: The Ardbeg Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’   This release, although bottled at a lower ABV than the Committee Release, has garnered great reviews, including one from Dramming.com's Oliver Klimek. It has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

NAME: Glen Moray - Cider Cask Project
DESCRIPTION: This is a UK exclusive experimental release from Glen Moray. This whisky has been finished in ones that were previously used to hold Thistly Cross Scottish craft cider.  This is a small batch bottling and this is one of just 2000 bottles produced.

NAME: Glenallachie - 18 Year Old Cask #4152 2001 Uk Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Built and founded in 1967, The GlenAllachie malt whisky distillery was overseen by Mackinlay McPherson. A few years later in 1985 it was bought and mothballed by Invergordon Distillers. 1989 saw it bought by Campbell Distillers who looked to breathe new life into it. Its most recent history sees the master Billy Walker at the helm with Graham Stevenson and Trisha Savage by his side. Famous for their single cask releases and their sherried expressions, this distillery is one of the most exciting ones of modern times.
This single cask was distilled in 2001 and bottled August 2019. Cask #4152 was a PX Higshead and yielded 307 bottles. 
Bottle 151.

NAME: Kilkerran - 8 Year Old Sherry Cask Strength 57.1%
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for 8 years in a first fill sherry cask...the colour says it all really! Beautiful. 
Kilkerran is derived from the gaelic "Caen Loch Cille Chiarain" which is the name of the original settlement where Saint Kieran had his religious cell.

NAME: Bruichladdich - Babe 1990 Valinch
DESCRIPTION:
Famous for its Whisky and now its Gin this is an early bottling that celebrates the Middle White Pig Society visit to the distillery on Islay. 
The distillery now instantly recognisable due to its unique colour is owned by Rémy Cointreau. 
This is from a refill Sherry Butt.
Distilled on 5th Sept 1990 and bottled on 5/12/2003 from Cask number 3666.
Bottle 225.

NAME: Springbank - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 18-year-old is full of authority and is truly a classic, full-bodied dram. With a delicious nose, this whisky will tempt you in and hold your attention as you uncover its unique palate and finish.

NAME: Highland Park - Quercus - Keystone Series 3rd Release
DESCRIPTION:
The Keystones Series 3rd release, from Highland Park, Quercus.
The series explores five traditional 'keystones' that have been essential for the production and have been unchanged for 220 years.
The bottle takes its name from the kind of Oak used to make their casks. They are sent to Spain (Jerez) in order to in sherry before returning to the distillery. 
This is one of only 1200 bottles.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Fire
DESCRIPTION: This stunning Highland Park 15 year old single malt follows the 'Ice' edition to complete this Highland Park two-part series. The 'Fire' edition celebrates Muspelheim, the glowing Norse fire realm of destruction.  The malt was matured in refill Port casks and bottled at 45.2% abv. It's presented in a cradle shaped like a mountain.

NAME: Highland Park - Hobbister
DESCRIPTION:
Hobbister is the first release in the Highland Park Keystone Series – a collection of special bottlings that highlight our five Keystones of production which combine to make Highland Park stand apart from other Single Malts.
The special edition takes its name from a peat moor.  This environment creates a unique aromatic peat consisting of decaying heather and plants rather than the trees that characterise the peat used by other distilleries.
A release of 1,200 bottles.

NAME: Blanton's - Single Barrel Gold Edition #3
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
Drawn from a single barrel, number 3, which was stored on rick number 53. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.
This is bottle number 70.

NAME: GlenDronach - 14 Year Old - Hand Filled 2005 - Cask #1938
DESCRIPTION:
A Distillery Exclusive from Glendronach has been hand filled straight from the cask, at the cask strength of 57.9% ABV.
Distilled on the 6th of December 2005, aged in Px puncheon number 1938 and bottled on 23rd August 2020.
This is bottle number 30.

NAME: Kaiyo - Mizunara Oak Cask Strength
DESCRIPTION: A cask strength Kaiyo Whisky. This Japanese malt has been matured in rare mizunara casks.  Kaiyo even shipping their casks out to sea for months before bottling as the motion may get even more flavour out of the wood.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Master Edition
DESCRIPTION: Released for the 2010 Feis Ile and sold exclusively from Laphroaig Distillery.  Cairdeas, meaning Friendship, is an annual limited edition release from Laphroaig Distillery. This bottling is a harmony of malt ranging from 11 to 19 years of age. It was specifically selected by Laphroaig Master Blender Robert Hicks in celebration of the 2010 Feis Ile and Friends of Laphroaig worldwide.

NAME: Kilchoman - 12 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: Due to the cancellation of Fèis Ìle 2020, this year's Kilchoman festival release was an online exclusive and is one of just 2630 bottles available.  Matured in ex-bourbon barrels for a minimum of 12 years and bottled at the cask strength (54.2%).

NAME: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - 2004 Hand Filled - Cask #1873
DESCRIPTION:
A hand-filled Bowmore distilled on the 14th May 2004, matured in bourbon cask #1873 & bottled on the 22 May 2018. It was available exclusively at Bowmore Distillery.
 
This bottle is number nine.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

NAME: Nikka - Taketsuru Fortune ‘80
DESCRIPTION:
A blend from Taketsuru in the 1980s which was discontinued in the following decade.
Rarely seen at auction, this blend is originally from Nikka and for the experts among us will deduce that this should have Miyagikyo and Yoichi contained within.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

NAME: Aultmore - 12 Year Old Single Highland Malt - 1980s
DESCRIPTION: Produced in the Speyside area of Scotland's craggy Grampian Region, Aultmore has a unique flavour. Aultmore has a unique flavour, and a smooth mellowness which only 12 years of maturing in cask will impart.

NAME: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Virgin Oak #1590
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery.  It was distilled in March 2009 and matured in virgin oak cask #1558 until December 2019 when it was bottled at 56.8% abv. 
Bottle 39.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 10 Year Old - Traditional 100 Proof
DESCRIPTION: An early version, that is now rare, bottling of high-strength Glenmorangie, bottled at full proof (57.2%)  for the duty-free market.  This is a 1L bottling.

NAME: Black Friday - 21 Year Old - Whisky Exchange III 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The third release from The Whisky Exchange and their Black Friday bottling. It sold out in 11 minutes because it an outstanding dram. It was bottled at cask strength...
Last year’s release was a Highland Park (unofficial) and this year an older undisclosed Speyside 21 Year Old year old was chosen.
They did disclose that the distillery was founded as early as 1810, located between Forres and Elgin and rarely seen as a single malt whisky.
Glen Burgie?????

NAME: Glenmorangie - Sherry Wood Finish
DESCRIPTION: After initially maturing in American Oak cask, this Glenmorangie was then allowed a special finishing period in selected sherry 'butts'.  The sherry finish has made this Glenmorangie extra special.  The wood finish range was discontinued in Summer 2007.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2002 Spanish Oak Finish - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 2002, this Bunnahabhain single malt was aged for 15 years - it was initially aged in whisky refill cask and then in 2013 it was allowed a finishing period in Spanish oak Gran Reserva casks.  This was a limited release of just 1500 bottles.  This was one of two bottlings from Bunnahabhain released in celebration of Fèis Ìle 2018.

NAME: Invergordon - 22 Year Old 1997 Old Particular
DESCRIPTION:
Only 155 bottles of this single grain scotch whisky have been produced from the Highland distillery, Invergordon.
Distilled in May 1997 this cask strength expression was aged for 22 years before being bottled by the family-owned firm Douglas Laing. 
Presented in a lovely wooden case.

NAME: Glen Moray - 21 Year Old SMWS 35.243 - 21st Anniversary London Branch + Glass
DESCRIPTION:
This Speyside single malt is from Glen Moray and has been aged for 21 years.  This is one of only 167 bottles produced in celebration of the SMWS London Branch -  the release has been named 'A Tropical Treasure'
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

NAME: Clynelish - 1997 The Merchistonian Club Whisky 2006
DESCRIPTION:
A quite unique bottling from the Highland distillery, Clynelish which is situated in Brora. This dram was distilled in 1997 and bottled in 2016 from cask #12382. It is one of only 264 bottles produced. 
The box bears a coat of arms reading Ready - Ay - Ready which comes from Merchiston Preparatory School founded in Pietermaritzburg, South Africa in 1892.

NAME: Octomore - 5 Year Old - Masterclass 9.3 Dialogos
DESCRIPTION:
52 tonnes of barley, grown on Islay, were used to produce this edition of Ocotmore.  διάλογος in ancient Greek translates to Dalogos, which this Octomore series 9 has been named.
Peated to 133 PPM this Octomores time was mostly spent in second-fill oak casks. 18000 bottles of this peat monster have been produced.

NAME: Bowmore - 18 Year Old - Vintner's Trilogy I (Manzanilla Cask)
DESCRIPTION:
This is the first release in Bowmore's Vintner's Trilogy - each released with different wine finish. This 18 year old was aged in bourbon barrels for 13 years with a finishing period in manzanilla sherry casks for an additional five years.
It has resulted in an impressive dram with notes of salted caramel, spiced orange and ripe blackcurrants and a healthy dose of peat smoke.

NAME: Octomore - 10.3 Islay Barley
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 2013 from the 2012 harvest, the Octomore 10.3 was brought home by farmer James Brown.  For the first time, the .3 is matured for six aged years exclusively in ex-American oak.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Sheestown 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Sheestown 1.1 – This is also one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was grown by Robert Milne on one of Ireland’s premier malting barley terroirs – the famous Clonroche Series in Co. Wexford, with its loamy, clay soils derived from slate and granite.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.2 - 2019 (With Macallan Bag)
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

NAME: Glen Moray - 21 Year Old SMWS 35.243 - 21st Anniversary London Branch
DESCRIPTION:
This Speyside single malt is from Glen Moray and has been aged for 21 years.  This is one of only 167 bottles produced in celebration of the SMWS London Branch -  the release has been named 'A Tropical Treasure'
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.2 - 2019 (With Macallan Bag)
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old  2002 - Single Cask #2118 - Switzerland
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Switzerland.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 15 years in 1st fill American sherry oak butt #2118 at bottled at the cask strength of 59.1% ABV.  With only 576 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #6551 - San Diego
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for San Diego.  Distilled in 2004, this single malt was matured for 12 years in First Fill European Sherry Oak Butt #6551 and bottled at the cask strength of 65.6% ABV.  With only 294 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Glen Moray - 21 Year Old SMWS 35.243 - 21st Anniversary London Branch
DESCRIPTION:
This Speyside single malt is from Glen Moray and has been aged for 21 years.  This is one of only 167 bottles produced in celebration of the SMWS London Branch -  the release has been named 'A Tropical Treasure Chest'
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.

NAME: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Virgin Oak #1590
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask bottling was hand-filled at Bowmore Distillery.  It was distilled in March 2009 and matured in virgin oak cask #1558 until December 2019 when it was bottled at 56.8% abv. 
This is bottle number 6.

NAME: Glenrothes - 19 Year Old - Single Cask (No.8190)
DESCRIPTION:
This Glenrothes is part of The Exclusive Single Cask Series, bottled exclusively for London Heathrow Airport. The 19 year old whisky was drawn from bourbon-seasoned cask no. 8190 and bottled at cask strength of 55.4% 
It was launched as part of the annual airport Whisky Festival (1-30 April).  Just 274 individually-numbered bottles were available.
Bottle 78.

NAME: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Virgin Oak #1590
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask bottling was hand-filled at Bowmore Distillery.  It was distilled in March 2009 and matured in virgin oak cask #1558 until December 2019 when it was bottled at 56.8% abv. 
This is bottle number 8.

NAME: Glenfarclas - £511.19s.0d - Family Reserve
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled by Glenfarclas to celebrate 150th years of the distillery being owned by the Grant family.
John Grant paid £511.19s. for the distillery on 8th June 1865 which is where the name of this bottle came from.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Master Edition
DESCRIPTION: Released for the 2010 Feis Ile and sold exclusively from Laphroaig Distillery.  Cairdeas, meaning Friendship, is an annual limited edition release from Laphroaig Distillery. This bottling is a harmony of malt ranging from 11 to 19 years of age. It was specifically selected by Laphroaig Master Blender Robert Hicks in celebration of the 2010 Feis Ile and Friends of Laphroaig worldwide.

NAME: Auchroisk - 20 Year Old - 1997 - The Octave Cask
DESCRIPTION: Part of the Duncan Taylor Series this 1997 vintage Dulmunach was matured for 20 years in cask #7716279 followed by 9 months in Octave 9.  This is one of just 43 bottles released in 2018.

NAME: Kilchoman - 12 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: Due to the cancellation of Fèis Ìle 2020, this year's Kilchoman festival release was an online exclusive and is one of just 2630 bottles available.  Matured in ex-bourbon barrels for a minimum of 12 years and bottled at the cask strength (54.2%).

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask Series #1933 - Dannebrog
DESCRIPTION: This release is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  It was bottled for the to celebrate the 808th year anniversary of the Danish flag ‘Dannebrog’.  The single malt was distilled in 2003, matured in Refill Butt 2016 #1933 for 13 years. This was a limited edition to only 648 bottles produced.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 14 Year Old (2005) Burgundy Finish
DESCRIPTION: This Bunnahabhain was distilled in late 2005 and was matured in refill whisky hogsheads before being transferred Burgundy wine casks for the rest of the maturation period. This is one of 600 bottles.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #3600 - Texas
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Texas.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in refill sherry butt #3600 and was bottled at the cask strength of 62.7% ABV.  With only 600 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 14 Year Old SMWS 10.188
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This bottling was released for the cancelled Feis Ile in 2020. It is one of only 489 bottles and is labelled "New Acquaintance"

NAME: Macallan - Whisky Maker's Edition - Classic Travel Range 1930s Propeller Plane
DESCRIPTION:
Released for the travel retail market, this single malt is part of The Macallan Whisky Maker's Edition Classic Travel Range.  It was crafted by Bob Dalgarno, Macallan's distillery manager, using whisky drawn from a combination of Sherry and bourbon casks.  It is bottled at his preferred strength of 42.8%. 
The range includes a set of 4 different bottle labels and outer boxes, with x-ray photography celebrating the art of travel, designed by Nick Veasey.
This lot is the 1930's propeller plane design which features both on the bottle lable and on the outer box.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2004 PX - Coterie
DESCRIPTION: This  Bunnahabhain expression was released exclusively for the Coterie Club members. It was distilled in 2004 and matured for 15 years then finished in Pedro Ximenez sherry casks for 6 years.  This bottle was hand-filled at the distillery.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.2 - 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

NAME: Ardbeg - Alligator - 5cl Mini (Leather Case)
DESCRIPTION:
An alligator skin is one that looks cracked and full of scars that would have been caused during a heated battle. Well, that exactly where the name of this whisky comes from. When heat is applied to the inside of a cask, the wood begins to crack...'alligator char'.
This is the un-tammed release which came after the committee release in 2012.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Estate Ballymorgan 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Ballymorgan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series grown by Robert Milne on one of Ireland’s premier malting barley terroirs – the famous Clonroche Series in Co. Wexford, with its loamy, clay soils derived from slate and granite.

NAME: Pillage Trilogy - 12 Year Old 2005 Blended Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Pillaged from each of the operating Islay distilleries and from Bushmills in Northern Ireland and just across the water on Jura.
The masters behind this bend rowed between each of the distilleries in order to collect the whisky which was eventually created for all proceeds to be donated to charitable causes.

NAME: Glen Moray - 21 Year Old SMWS 35.243 - 21st Anniversary London Branch
DESCRIPTION:
This Speyside single malt is from Glen Moray and has been aged for 21 years.  This is one of only 167 bottles produced in celebration of the SMWS London Branch -  the release has been named 'A Tropical Treasure Chest'
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.

NAME: Kilchoman - 12 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: Due to the cancellation of Fèis Ìle 2020, this year's Kilchoman festival release was an online exclusive and is one of just 2630 bottles available.  Matured in ex-bourbon barrels for a minimum of 12 years and bottled at the cask strength (54.2%).

NAME: Islay Mist - 8 Year Old
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macduff Glen Deveron Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION: Islay Mist 8 Year Old - including Laphroaig Single Malt. Islay Mist retains the smoky flavour of Laphroaig whilst offering a beautiful softness.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old #2103 Whisky Brother
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Whisky Brother.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in a refill Butt #2013 at a cask strength of 60.4%% ABV.  With only 552 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.
This is a 75cl bottling.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 11 Year Old - 2008 Manzanilla Cask
DESCRIPTION: This limited release from Bunnahabhain and is a 2008 vintage Manzanilla cask matured single malt.  Bottled in May 2020 at 52.3%. This 11-Year-Old, matured in warehouse 9 has rich flavours of nuts, fruits and toffee, with a salted caramel finish.

NAME: Braeval - 17 Year Old - Single Cask Edition - Distillery Reserve Collection
DESCRIPTION:
This Braeval 17 Year Old single malt was released as part of the Distillery Reserve Collection. These single cask bottlings were exclusively available at Chivas Brothers distilleries.
Distilled on the 26th of March 2005, it was bottled at cask strength from a single first-fill barrel, #13913 on the 26th of March 2002.  This is one of just 276 individually numbered bottles produced.  This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 96.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 14 Year Old (2005) Burgundy Finish
DESCRIPTION:
This Bunnahabhain was distilled in late 2005 and was matured in refill whisky hogsheads before being transferred Burgundy wine casks for the rest of the maturation period. This is one of 600 bottles.
This is bottle number 157.

NAME: Bowmore - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is a 70cl bottling of 12-Year-Old Bowmore. This single malt has coastal notes with gentle peat.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 10 Year Old - Skerryvore Decade
DESCRIPTION: A 10-year-old Bruichladdich to celebrate 10 years of Skerryvore Scottish folk-rock band. The single cask was selected by Jim Mcewen, and this is one of just 290 bottles.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Sheestown 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Sheestown 1.1 – This is also one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was grown by Robert Milne on one of Ireland’s premier malting barley terroirs – the famous Clonroche Series in Co. Wexford, with its loamy, clay soils derived from slate and granite.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #6712 - The bishop Arms
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for The Bishop Arms, which is a pub in Sweden.  This 'William the Old' edition was distilled in 2004, and matured for 12 years in European Oak Sherry Butt #6712 and bottled at the cask strength of 63.1% ABV.  With only 492 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Sheestown 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Sheestown 1.1 – This is also one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was grown by Robert Milne on one of Ireland’s premier malting barley terroirs – the famous Clonroche Series in Co. Wexford, with its loamy, clay soils derived from slate and granite.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.2 - 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Estate Ballymorgan 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Ballymorgan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series grown by Robert Milne on one of Ireland’s premier malting barley terroirs – the famous Clonroche Series in Co. Wexford, with its loamy, clay soils derived from slate and granite.

NAME: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Master Edition
DESCRIPTION: Released for the 2010 Feis Ile and sold exclusively from Laphroaig Distillery.  Cairdeas, meaning Friendship, is an annual limited edition release from Laphroaig Distillery. This bottling is a harmony of malt ranging from 11 to 19 years of age. It was specifically selected by Laphroaig Master Blender Robert Hicks in celebration of the 2010 Feis Ile and Friends of Laphroaig worldwide.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1992 Valinch 'Team Bruichladdich'
DESCRIPTION:
This distillery exclusive bottling was distilled in 1992, and matured bourbon casks followed by Chateau D'yquem. Bottled in 2010, this is one of 400 numbered bottles available.  This bottling celebrates the British racing team now known as 'Team Bruichladdich' in the 2010 European Le Mans Series.
 
This is bottle number 214.

NAME: Waterford - SFO - Bannow Island &  Ballykilcavan 1.2
DESCRIPTION:
This lot includes 2 x 70cl bottlings:
Ballykilcavan: Edition 1.2 – the second release, uses barley grown by David Walsh-Kemmis west of the Barrow in Co. Laois in the barley heartlands, where his fertile fields are sheltered by ancient woodland. Bottled at 50% ABV without colouring, chill-filtration or any additives.
Bannow Island: Edition 1.2 - the second Bannow Island release by Waterford. Now 3 months older, this expression is from barley grown by Ed Harpur on the extreme southern coast of Co. Wexford, where salt-laden Atlantic winds and sandy soils create a unique, if challenging, terroir.

NAME: Macallan - Classic Cut - 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Classic Cut - 2019 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 52.9% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

NAME: Blanton's - Single Barrel Gold Edition #552
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
Drawn from a single barrel, number 552, which was stored on rick number 17. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.

NAME: Blanton's - Single Barrel Gold Edition #65
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
Drawn from a single barrel, number 65, which was stored on rick number 39. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.
This is bottle number 183.

NAME: Talisker - 8 Year Old 2009 Cask Strength Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled on the beautiful Island of Skye on the west coast of Scotland in 2009. This limited release was distilled in 2009 and matured in a first fill Ex-bourbon American Oak cask. 
This distillery is now part of Diageo's portfolio.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1989 Valinch 'Lord Robertson' (SIGNED)
DESCRIPTION:
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process. The term Valinch is a piece of old whisky terminology that comes from the Spanish & French. It is the word for a pipette that takes the samples from a cask. These bottlings were introduced to the public after the distillery was purchased in 2001 by Murray McDavid.
This bottling was distilled on 14th April 1989.
It bears a label that shows  Lord Robertson of Port Ellen. This Valinch was matured in refill sherry cask number #1009 and only 390 were produced. 
Signed by Jim McEwan and is bottle 115.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.4
DESCRIPTION: The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1990 Valinch 'Viking Visit'
DESCRIPTION:
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process.
This particular bottling commemorates the visit of a replica longboat that was found and preserved in clay in Olso in July 2005.
Only 348 bottles were ever released after maturing in a refill bourbon squat hogshead #716. 
This is bottle number 3.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1989 Valinch 'Lord Robertson' (SIGNED)
DESCRIPTION:
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process. The term Valinch is a piece of old whisky terminology that comes from the Spanish & French. It is the word for a pipette that takes the samples from a cask. These bottlings were introduced to the public after the distillery was purchased in 2001 by Murray McDavid.
This bottling was distilled on 14th April 1989.
It bears a label that shows  Lord Robertson of Port Ellen. This Valinch was matured in refill sherry cask number #1009 and only 390 were produced. 
This bottle is signed and is bottle 117.

NAME: Glen Moray - 21 Year Old SMWS 35.243 - 21st Anniversary London Branch
DESCRIPTION:
This Speyside single malt is from Glen Moray and has been aged for 21 years.  This is one of only 167 bottles produced in celebration of the SMWS London Branch -  the release has been named 'A Tropical Treasure'
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.

NAME: Blanton's - Single Barrel Gold Edition #552
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
Drawn from a single barrel, number 552, which was stored on rick number 17. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.
Bottle 43.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Fire
DESCRIPTION: This stunning Highland Park 15 year old single malt follows the 'Ice' edition to complete this Highland Park two-part series. The 'Fire' edition celebrates Muspelheim, the glowing Norse fire realm of destruction.  The malt was matured in refill Port casks and bottled at 45.2% abv. It's presented in a cradle shaped like a mountain.

NAME: Highland Park - Yesnaby - Keystone 4th Release
DESCRIPTION:
The Keystones Series 4th release, from Highland Park, Yesnaby.
The series explores five traditional 'keystones' that have been essential for the production and have been unchanged for 220 years.
The bottle takes its name from the cliff on the coast of the Islands. Atlantic side.
Cask Info
- First-fill Sherry seasoned American Oak casks.
This is one of only 1200 bottles.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Blanton's - Single Barrel Gold Edition #3
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
Drawn from a single barrel, number 3, which was stored on rick number 53. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.
This is bottle number 233.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - 200th Anniversary Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This limited release 10-year-old Laphroaig single malt was bottled to commemorate Laphroigs 200th Anniversary.  To mark their bicentenary they brought back their 10-Year-Old for a limited edition release. 
On another note but celebrating the same anniversary the Laphroaig 15 Year Old was first released in the 1980s, but it was eventually replaced with the Laphroaig 18-Year-Old.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Blanton's - Single Barrel Gold Edition #4
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
Drawn from a single barrel, number 4, which was stored on rick number 53. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.
This is bottle number 265.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Blanton's - Single Barrel Gold Edition #8
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
Drawn from a single barrel, number 8, which was stored on rick number 53. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.
This is bottle number 101.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Blanton's - Single Barrel Gold Edition #4
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
Drawn from a single barrel, number 4, which was stored on rick number 53. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.
This is bottle number 234.

NAME: Highland Park - Sigurd
DESCRIPTION: Highland Park Sigurd was originally a Travel Retail Exclusive and was released as part of the warrior series.  It was partially matured in European oak. It is named after a legendary hero of Norse mythology.

NAME: Clynelish - 14 Year Old 100 Years Marine Hotel
DESCRIPTION:
This malt is often considered the flagship expression from Clynelish Distillery - the successor to Brora Distillery which closed in 1983. This is a well rounded Highland malt.
This is a special bottling commissioned by the Marine hotel to celebrate 100 years of operation.

NAME: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Virgin Oak #1590
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask bottling was hand-filled at Bowmore Distillery.  It was distilled in March 2009 and matured in virgin oak cask #1558 until December 2019 when it was bottled at 56.8% abv. 
This bottle is number eleven.

NAME: Yamazaki - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

NAME: Aberfeldy - 21 Year Old - Limited Release
DESCRIPTION:
From the eastern highlands, this award-winning malt was pretty much removed from everyone's thoughts, that was until it was bought over by Bacardi. Aberfeldy has a highly rated visitor centre which opened at the turn of the millennium and attracts over thirty thousand visitors a year.
Brought to market in 2005, this 21-year-old is one of Aberfeldy flagship bottles. 
The World Whisky Awards, in 2007 awarded this the Best Mainland Single Malt.
This is bottle number 112548.

NAME: Glenfarclas - 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is exceptional and presented in a case with the gold logo on the front. 
25 Year Old - 43% ABV, 70cl.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 18 Year Old Small Batch
DESCRIPTION: Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old is part of their core range and it packs a punch! You will go a long way to find a dram with more depth.

NAME: Kilkerran - 8 Year Old Sherry Cask Strength 57.1%
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for 8 years in a first fill sherry cask...the colour says it all really! Beautiful. 
Kilkerran is derived from the gaelic "Caen Loch Cille Chiarain" which is the name of the original settlement where Saint Kieran had his religious cell.

NAME: Laphroaig - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

NAME: Aultmore - 21 Year Old - Foggie Moss
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle is a 21 year old from the Aultmore distillery.
It has an exceptionally smooth, clean and fruity taste which comes from the courtesy of the gorse- and heather-filtered waters of the Foggie Moss and malted barley free from peat smoke.
This bottle is from a refill hogshead and was bottled at 46%.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 11 Year Old - 2008 Manzanilla Cask
DESCRIPTION: This limited release from Bunnahabhain and is a 2008 vintage Manzanilla cask matured single malt.  Bottled in May 2020 at 52.3%. This 11-Year-Old, matured in warehouse 9 has rich flavours of nuts, fruits and toffee, with a salted caramel finish.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2010 - Amontillado Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 6 years in classic bourbon barrels, after which the single malt was transferred to Amontillado sherry Hogsheads for another three years.  It was bottled at 56.9% and was released by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1658 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 1277.

NAME: Mortlach - 17 Year Old 2003 - Adelphi #800261
DESCRIPTION: Mortlach single cask #800261 was bottled by Adelphi for their Selection series in 2020.  Distilled in 2003 and aged for 17 years, this is one of only 224 bottles produced at the natural cask strength of 57.6%.

NAME: Blanton's - Single Barrel Gold Edition #2
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
Blanton's Single Bourbon is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
Drawn from a single barrel, number 2, which was stored on rick number 53. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.
This is bottle number 194.

NAME: Clynelish - 15 Year Old Càrn Mòr 1997
DESCRIPTION:
From Càrn Mòrs strictly limited range, this bottling is presented in their new style of packaging. 
Bottled by Morrison and Mackay whisky merchants. Only 605 bottled were produced from 2 casks. 
They were distilled in 1997 and bottled in 2002.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Port Charlotte - 2001 Valinch First Cut 27/05/07
DESCRIPTION:
A super peated single malt which is produced at Bruichladdich, this is under the Port Charlotte label. These bottlings were introduced to the public after the distillery was purchased in 2001 by Murray McDavid. No longer standing, this line of branding is named after a towns neighbouring distillery, Port Charlotte, which was actually unseated!! They were quick to change this and now have lines such as Lochindaal and Octomore…which we all know have some serious peaty punch.
The majority of Valinch bottlings are all 50cl and all single casks that are available from the distillery. If you know and have been to the magical island you too can take part in the hand-filling process.
One of only 950 bottles from cask 007. It was distilled in 2001 and bottled in MAy 2007.

NAME: Speyside - 22 Year Old - Chorlton Whisky
DESCRIPTION: A mystery blended Speyside malt from Chorlton. Distilled in November 1997, it was aged for 22 years in a hogshead cask before being bottled.  This is one of just 133 bottles.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old Single Cask Series Sydäntalvi #2155
DESCRIPTION:
One in the large series of single cask bottlings from the Orcadian distillery Highland Park. This specific bottling was done for the Finnish Sydäntalvi. It was distilled in 2001 and bottled in 2017. Only 576 bottles were produced from the single cask #2155.
It was an American Oak Sherry Butt that the whisky was aged for 15 years. 
Cask Strength: 61.3%

NAME: Yamazaki - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

NAME: Clynelish - 1993 Gordon & MacPhail - Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION: Distilled at Clynelish in 1993 and bottled in 2005 by Gordon and MacPhail for their Connoisseurs Choice range.

NAME: Ichiro's Malt - Mizunara Wood Reserve
DESCRIPTION:
Venture Whisky are behind the Ichiro's Malt brand and of course it is named after their legendary founder Ichiro Akuto.  Ichiro inherited the last remaining stocks of single malt from the Hanyu distillery (It was his Grandfathers) and Venture Whisky came to fruition in 2004. 
In 2008, the company opened its own distillery, Chichibu which is now highly sought after by collectors and whisky fans. 
Thus, this bottling is tipped to be a vatting of the closed Japanese distillery of Hanyu combined with young expressions from Chichibu. 
This expression boasts whiskies that were matured in Mizunara oak casks.

NAME: Glenallachie - 18 Year Old Cask #4152 2001 Uk Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Built and founded in 1967, The GlenAllachie malt whisky distillery was overseen by Mackinlay McPherson. A few years later in 1985 it was bought and mothballed by Invergordon Distillers. 1989 saw it bought by Campbell Distillers who looked to breathe new life into it. Its most recent history sees the master Billy Walker at the helm with Graham Stevenson and Trisha Savage by his side. Famous for their single cask releases and their sherried expressions, this distillery is one of the most exciting ones of modern times.
This single cask was distilled in 2001 and bottled August 2019. Cask #4152 was a PX Higshead and yielded 307 bottles.

NAME: Girvan - 26 Year Old 1992 - North Star
DESCRIPTION: A rare single cask Girvan single grain 26-year-old, bottled by North Star Spirits. Drawn from a bourbon barrel and 53.5% ABV in March 2019, this is one of just 180 bottles released for the single cask series No 008.

NAME: Macallan - Classic Cut - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Classic Cut - 2018 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 51.2% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

NAME: Bimber - Oloroso Cask - Small Batch #2
DESCRIPTION: One of only 920 bottles in the Bimber Oloroso Sherry Batch 2 Small Batch release. It was carefully crafted from a vatting of first-fill ex-bourbon casks that were finished in Spanish oloroso sherry. It offers a silky texture with a distinctive fruit-focussed character and layers of rich, sweet intensity.

NAME: Glenallachie - 15 Year Old 2004 #6213 UK Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Built and founded in 1967, The GlenAllachie malt whisky distillery was overseen by Mackinlay McPherson. A few years later in 1985 it was bought and mothballed by Invergordon Distillers. 1989 saw it bought by Campbell Distillers who looked to breathe new life into it. Its most recent history sees the master Billy Walker at the helm with Graham Stevenson and Trisha Savage by his side. Famous for their single cask releases and their sherried expressions, this distillery is one of the most exciting ones of modern times.
Distilled in 2004, this bottling of Glenallachie was matured for 15 years and was bottled in August 2019, yielding 354 bottles.

NAME: Kilkerran - 8 Year Old Sherry Cask Strength 57.1%
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for 8 years in a first fill sherry cask...the colour says it all really! Beautiful. 
Kilkerran is derived from the gaelic "Caen Loch Cille Chiarain" which is the name of the original settlement where Saint Kieran had his religious cell.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Macallan - Classic Cut - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Classic Cut - 2018 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 51.2% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 12 Year Old - 2007 - Micro Provenance #3668
DESCRIPTION:
Bruichladdich unique Micro-Provenance series is as a series of single cask bottlings, released exclusively online.
This is a limited edition of just 300 individually numbered bottles.  It was matured in Virgin Oak cask #3668. distilled in December 2007,  it was then bottled in over 12 years later in November 2019 at 63.8% ABV.

NAME: Yamazaki - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

NAME: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #2542 - Hsiu Ming
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Hsiu Ming.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 14 years in first fill European sherry oak butt #2542 and was bottled at the cask strength of 59.8% ABV. 
With only 636 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - 2002 Single Cask Series (Chris Maile, 13th Oslo Whisky Festival)
DESCRIPTION:
This Single Cask release by Highland Park has been matured for 13 years in a 1st fill European Sherry Hogshead cask #6352. This is one of just 306 bottles produced. 
This release was named in honour of Chris Maile, the whisky guru behind the Oslo Whisky Festival, the Trondheim Whisky Festival and the Arctic Whisky Festival). The bottling was officially released at the 13th Oslo Whisky Festival, in 2016.

NAME: Deanston - 21 Year Old 1995 - Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION: This 21 year old single malt from the Deanston distillery, aged in single hogshead HL12816  Distilled in August 1995 and was then bottles in October 2016 by Hunter Laing for their Old Malt Cask range. This bottle is one of a release of 263 bottles.

NAME: Benromach - 17 Year Old - Centenary
DESCRIPTION: This release celebrates the Benromach's Centenary. This 17-Year-Old spent its final two years in sherry casks dating from 1886, 1895 and 1901. It was bottled in 1998 by Gordon & Macphail shortly after taking over and re-invigorated the distillery after a fifteen-year distilling hiatus.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #2911 - Le Clos
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Le Clos.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 15 years in refill hogshead #2911 at a cask strength of 55.3% ABV.  With only 162 bottles available, this is a very limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - 2002 Single Cask Series (Chris Maile, 13th Oslo Whisky Festival)
DESCRIPTION:
This Single Cask release by Highland Park has been matured for 13 years in a 1st fill European Sherry Hogshead cask #6352. This is one of just 306 bottles produced. 
This release was named in honour of Chris Maile, the whisky guru behind the Oslo Whisky Festival, the Trondheim Whisky Festival and the Arctic Whisky Festival). The bottling was officially released at the 13th Oslo Whisky Festival, in 2016.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #1294 - Viking Line (Batch 4)
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Viking Line.  This bottle is from batch 4. Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 13 years in first-fill American Sherry Oak Puncheon #1294 and bottled at the cask strength of 60.8% ABV in 2018.  With only 623 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old #6120 2004 Valletta
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
Distilled in 2004 and bottled in 2018 this 13 year old was bottled exclusively for Valletta. It comes from cask #6120 and was matured in a Refill Puncheon.

NAME: Kilkerran - 8 Year Old Sherry Cask Strength 57.1%
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for 8 years in a first fill sherry cask...the colour says it all really! Beautiful. 
Kilkerran is derived from the gaelic "Caen Loch Cille Chiarain" which is the name of the original settlement where Saint Kieran had his religious cell.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #3445 - Le Clos
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Le Clos. Distilled in 2002 this single malt was matured for 15 years in refill Hogshead #3445 at the cask strength of 58.2% ABV.  With only 306 bottles available, this is a very limited edition.

NAME: Auchroisk - 20 Year Old - 1997 - The Octave Cask
DESCRIPTION: Part of the Duncan Taylor Series this 1997 vintage Dulmunach was matured for 20 years in cask #7716279 followed by 9 months in Octave 9.  This is one of just 43 bottles released in 2018.

NAME: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #3793 - Austria
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Austria.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in refill Puncheon #3793 and was bottled at the cask strength of 62.6% ABV.  With only 642 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #2966 - Bulgaria
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Bulgaria.  Distilled in 2005, this single malt was matured for 12 years in Refill Hogshead #2966 and bottled at the cask strength of 63% ABV.  With only 318 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Lockdown - Secret Speyside - The Taste of Whisky
DESCRIPTION:
The Taste of Whisky have produced a single malt bottling of Lock Down - Secret Speyside which was distilled in 2011 into matured 1st fill bourbon and finished in 1st fill px octave before being bottled in 2020 at 59.5% ABV. There are only 74 bottles.
This is bottle number 65.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2003 - Amontillado Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 2019 distillery exclusive from Bunnahabhain Distillery. This Amontillado Cask Finish limited edition started life on the 20th of February 2003 in refill hogsheads before being transferred to Amontillado sherry hogsheads on the 26th of February 2016 where it spent two more years maturing in Bunnahabhain's coastal warehouses.
The result is 1710 bottles of rich, oaky single malt, with notes of dark chocolate and treacle toffee.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old Sweden 2003 Single Cask #4462
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Single Cask Series for SWEDEN Ltd Edition 2018: 2 limited to 600 bottles.
Matured in a 1st fill European Oak Sherry Puncheon cask #4462.  Distilled in 2003 and bottled in 2018.
Cask Number 4462.

NAME: Glengoyne - 21 Year Old - Old Style
DESCRIPTION: Glengoyne  21 Year Old  Won a Gold Medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition 2005 but this is the older style.  This Highland single malt was matured in hand-selected quality first fill European oak sherry casks for 21 years.

NAME: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Virgin Oak #1590
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask bottling was hand-filled at Bowmore Distillery.  It was distilled in March 2009 and matured in virgin oak cask #1558 until December 2019 when it was bottled at 56.8% abv. 
This is bottle number 12.

NAME: Talisker - 2007 Cask Strength Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled on the beautiful Island of Skye on the west coast of Scotland this bottle was bottled in 2007. The bottle is cask strength of 53.9% ABV.
 
This is bottle number 74.

NAME: Ardbeg - Kelpie - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition bottling was produced to celebrate Ardbeg Day at the 2017 Fèis Ìle.
This single malt from Islay is the distillery's first to use virgin oak from the Black Sea coast for maturation.  Therefore it imparts deep flavour notes that only a very small amount of whiskies have ever before.  It was then married in ex-Bourbon casks.  This dram is packed with the seaside flavours of Ardbeg and peat smoke.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.2 - 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 11 Year Old - 2008 Manzanilla Cask
DESCRIPTION: This limited release from Bunnahabhain and is a 2008 vintage Manzanilla cask matured single malt.  Bottled in May 2020 at 52.3%. This 11-Year-Old, matured in warehouse 9 has rich flavours of nuts, fruits and toffee, with a salted caramel finish.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Estate Ballymorgan 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Ballymorgan 1.1 is one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series grown by Robert Milne on one of Ireland’s premier malting barley terroirs – the famous Clonroche Series in Co. Wexford, with its loamy, clay soils derived from slate and granite.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old #5734 Viking Line
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Viking Line. Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in a refill Butt #5734 at the cask strength of 63.1% ABV in 2018.  With only 300 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Lagavulin - 2017 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION: This release was personally selected by The Distillery Team and bottled at the cask strength of 54.1%. Limited to only 7,500 bottles, they were exclusively available at Lagavulin Distillery.

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.2 - 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

NAME: Highland Park - 14 Year Old Single Cask #3429 - Viking Line Batch #2
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Viking Line. This release is part of batch 2. Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 14 years in a refill hogshead #3429 and bottled at the cask strength of 54.7% ABV in 2017.  With only 258 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Sheestown 1.1
DESCRIPTION: Sheestown 1.1 – This is also one of the first releases from the Waterford Distillery's Single Farm Origin series. This single malt Irish whisky was grown by Robert Milne on one of Ireland’s premier malting barley terroirs – the famous Clonroche Series in Co. Wexford, with its loamy, clay soils derived from slate and granite.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old 2003 Single Cask #1935 Calle Cask No.1
DESCRIPTION:
One from the Single Cask series brought to you by Highland Park, comes this 13 year old single malt.
It was distilled in 2003 and bottled for Calle Cask No.1 in 2016.
It is one of 654 Bottles and had been matured in refill butt #1935.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - 2002 Single Cask Series (Chris Maile, 13th Oslo Whisky Festival)
DESCRIPTION:
This Single Cask release by Highland Park has been matured for 13 years in a 1st fill European Sherry Hogshead cask #6352. This is one of just 306 bottles produced. 
This release was named in honour of Chris Maile, the whisky guru behind the Oslo Whisky Festival, the Trondheim Whisky Festival and the Arctic Whisky Festival). The bottling was officially released at the 13th Oslo Whisky Festival, in 2016.

NAME: Highland Park - 1988 Gordon & Macphail 2013
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
This release comes from the Island of Orkney and was distilled at Highland Park distillery in 1988 and bottles in 2013. It comes under their Macphails collection label.

NAME: Highland Park - 16 Year Old 2001 Single Cask #386 Vintersolhverv
DESCRIPTION:
Only 594 bottles were produced from this vintage cask which is from Highland Parks single cask series. 
Distilled in 2001 and matured for 16 years before being bottled from cask #386, which was a European Sherry Oak Butt.
Vintersolhverv - "The Swedish winter solstice"

NAME: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #2791 - Heathrow and World of Whiskies
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Heathrow and World of Whiskies.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 14 years in refill butt #2791 and was bottled at the cask strength of 58.2% ABV.  With only 588 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #3374 - Loch Fyne Whiskies
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Loch Fyne Whiskies.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 15 years in refill butt #3374 at the cask strength of 58.4% ABV.  With only 584 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blasda (Limited Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in 2008, Ardbeg Blasda is a lesser-peated version of many people's favourite Islay malt, being just 8ppm in bottle (as opposed to the standard 10yo's 23ppm).  It is described as 'a lighter taste of Islay.' It has hints of sweets and chocolates for a pleasant accompaniment to the mild characteristic Ardbeg peaty tones. After all, 'Blasda' in Gaelic means 'sweet and delicious.'

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2004 Moine Port Pipe Finish - Feis Ile 2017
DESCRIPTION:
This 2004 vintage single malt from Bunnahabhain was limited to just 1596 bottles, released for the Feis Ile 2017.
Distilled in December 2004 it was matured in refill hogshead casks, then finished in Moine Port Pipes.  It was bottled in March 2017 at 55.6%. 
 
This is bottle number 619.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #6313 - Helluland
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Helluland.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in Refill Puncheon #6313 then bottled at the cask strength of 61.3% ABV.  With only 510 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

NAME: Bunnahabhain  - 18 Year Old - XVIII
DESCRIPTION: Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old is part of their core range. Becomes more and more desirable in the Asian markets, it packs a punch! You will go a long way to find a dram with more depth.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Deanston - 23 Year Old - Oloroso Matured
DESCRIPTION: A distillery exclusive release from Deanston Distillery.  This 23 Year Old was finished in Oloroso matured casks and bottled at cask strength.

NAME: Bunnahabhain  - 18 Year Old - XVIII
DESCRIPTION: Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old is part of their core range. Becomes more and more desirable in the Asian markets, it packs a punch! You will go a long way to find a dram with more depth.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #384 - The Whiskey House
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for The Whiskey House.  Distilled in 2001, this single malt was matured for 15 years in First Fill European Sherry Butt #384 at the cask strength of 62% ABV.  With only 474 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 16 Year Old - Single Cask #651 - Vintersolsnu
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled as Vintersolsnu.  Distilled in 2001, this single malt was matured for 16 years in European Oak Sherry Butt #651 at the cask strength of 58.8% ABV.  With only 588 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #6551 - Arizona 75cl
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Arizona.  Distilled in 2004, this single malt was matured for 12 years in first-fill European Sherry Oak Butt #6651 at the cask strength of 65.6% ABV.  With only 294 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1984 Valinch - Opening of The Harvey Bottling Hall
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling from Bruichladdich was distilled in 1984 and bottled from a single American Oak cask #12.  It was originally only available at Bruichladdich Distillery, released in celebration of the opening of The Harvey Bottling Hall on Sunday 25h of May 2003.  This is one of only 575 bottles. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle 192.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Glenfarclas - 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is exceptional and presented in a case with the gold logo on the front. 
25 Year Old - 43% ABV, 70cl.

NAME: Springbank - 15 Year Old - Rum Wood (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited edition, single malt Scotch whisky from Springbank distillery bottled and released in 2019.  The whisky was fully matured in rum casks for 15 years.   Bottled at a cask strength of 51.0% this is one of only 9,000 bottles released worldwide.

NAME: Ardbeg Blaaack - Committee 20th Anniversary - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This release marks the 20th anniversary of the Ardbeg Committee, with the release also timed for Ardbeg Day 2020.  Ardbeg Blaaack 20th Anniversary limited edition was matured in New Zealand Pinot Noir casks.

NAME: Wolfburn - Kylver Series - 2nd Release
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second instalment in the Wolfburn Distillery Kylver series. 
This single malt whisky was drawn from a combination of bourbon barrels and second-fill ex-Oloroso Sherry. Released in May 2017 at 50% ABV. This is one of 1450 bottles. 
The Kylver series follows the Viking runic alphabet engraved on a large stone excavated in Gotland (Sweden) in 1903.  The fourth symbol  is called “Ansuz”, which roughly translates as “god” or “gods”.  
Wolfburn Distillery is located in Thurso, making it the Northern most distillery on the UK mainland.  Based around a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn reopened in 2013.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Fire
DESCRIPTION: This stunning Highland Park 15 year old single malt follows the 'Ice' edition to complete this Highland Park two-part series. The 'Fire' edition celebrates Muspelheim, the glowing Norse fire realm of destruction.  The malt was matured in refill Port casks and bottled at 45.2% abv. It's presented in a cradle shaped like a mountain.

NAME: Bunnahabhain  - 18 Year Old - XVIII
DESCRIPTION: Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old is part of their core range. Becomes more and more desirable in the Asian markets, it packs a punch! You will go a long way to find a dram with more depth.

NAME: Ardbeg - Drum - 2019 Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This is the 2019 Ardbeg Drum Limited edition.  The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition is bottled at 46% abv.

NAME: Caol Ila - 12 Year Old - Feis Ile 2016
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 year old Caol Ila was bottled for the 2016 Feis Ile. Matured in refill American oak hogsheads and European oak bodega ex-sherry butts. Each bottle is individually numbered and was bottled at cask strength.
This is bottle number 297.

NAME: Glen Spey - 12 Year Old - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
